intro: Erythrodes commelinoides, commonly known as the red-flowered spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and striking red or pink inflorescences that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats, which can help stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Erythrodes commelinoides is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
